channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pot hole, 5th January
item.description:
This pothole is progressively getting worse, now has a ledge to it which could potentially create a tripping hazard in the road if crossing there. It has been there since last year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hall Place Crescent, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 5th January
item.description:
Dead fox on the ground, been there for 3 days. charlton lane on the grass next to the st alfeges road
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Lane, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Dog Litter bins, 5th January
item.description:
Resident called report there five overflowing dog litter bin in Bexley Woods at entrance of Camden Road and Elmwood Drive. Please can we inspect has this not been cleared since before Christmas. There are also bird boxes that have been left on the ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, West Woodside, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing light, 5th January
item.description:
Light was hit by car ~19:00 31/12/15?? Police were on attendance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calthorpe Street, Clerkenwell, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping of white goods & binbags, 5th January
item.description:
The gate for car entry to this block of apartments has been open for a few weeks as it’s not working. Over the Christmas period this had led to a massive build up of rubbish that isn’t from residents, including cardboard, food waste, white goods and other trash. We are now concerned that is has attracted rats as I have seen a few when trying to dispose of general waste, and the bins are too full.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Medlar Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 5th January
item.description:
There are plastic bag, cupboard cups, confectionery packaging and paper on the pavement and road. It has been there for three days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 165, Great Dover Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plastic boxes and lorry tyres, 5th January
item.description:
The flight tipping problem on Sundridge Avenue persists with yet more dumped rubbish . For the last two weeks I have been cleaning up some of the rubbish myself and put it in my own bin so my own refuse bin is half full of fly tipped rubbish. Some regular enforcement and warning signs needs to be in place as this is now becoming a weekly occurrence. Two weeks ago, somebody left three plastic containers of a blue fluid opposite my house,3 sundridge Avenue, I saw children kicking around so we emptied it ourselves into the drain and disposed of the containers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Grove, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus countdown STILL not working., 5th January
item.description:
Bus countdown still not working at the bus stop at St Marks church Bromley heading towards Bromley South. Ive reported this three times already.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blur liquid on Tabard street, 5th January
item.description:
There is blue liquid on the pavement and road on Tabard street. It sure if it is dangerous liquid, but it has not been removed despite fixmystreet stating it was on 4th January 2026.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street shears has litter all over it and general ness, 5th January
item.description:
Last complained before Xmas and steet was cleaned it hasn’t been regularly cleaned since Where are the street pickers/ckesners ?? Standards have to improve

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, St Luke's Avenue, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice/Temporary traffic lights, 5th January
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights have been placed so that the waiting area is directly on a large sheet of black ice – cars are not able to grip the road when the lights go green and this is dangerous and likely to cause an accident. This is outside 31 Brabourne rise in the direction going up to Hayes Lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Brabourne Rise, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Fly tipping, 5th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkhall Road, Catford South, Greater London

item.title: Water flooding down the road, 5th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Green, Falconwood, Greater London

item.title: 23 & 25 Dartmouth Road London NW24ET, 5th January
item.description:
The pavement outside houses 23 & 25 Dartmouth Road is in a hazardous and extremely slippery condition because of the ice. Note that a member of the public also had a nasty fall on the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dartmouth Road, London
